title: Build Once, Run Anywhere:
subtitle: Making Your Research Reproducible with Docker
speaker: Özgün Balaban

title: Cloud in a Coffee Break:
subtitle: Getting Started with SURF Research Cloud
speaker: Özgün Balaban
description: An introductory session on SURF Research Cloud, covering its features, benefits, and how to get started with cloud computing for research projects.

title: RDF/OWL + Large Language Models
speaker: Alex Donkers
description:
In this Coding Cafe, we will explore the intersection of RDF/OWL and Large Language Models (LLMs). We will discuss how semantic web technologies can enhance the capabilities of LLMs and vice versa. Topics include:

- Overview of RDF and OWL
- Introduction to Large Language Models
- How LLMs can leverage semantic data
- Practical applications and case studies

Join us for an engaging session that bridges the gap between semantic web technologies and cutting-edge AI models.

title: Working with Data
subtitle: From database concepts to a mini-SQL demo
description:
In this Coding Cafe, we will explore fundamental database concepts and demonstrate how to work with SQL through a mini-demo. Topics covered will include:

- Overview of database types (relational vs. NoSQL)
- Key concepts: tables, relationships, queries
- Hands-on mini-SQL demo: creating tables, inserting data, and querying

This session is designed for researchers and students who want to enhance their data management skills and understand how to effectively use databases in their projects.
speaker: Özgün Balaban
